author: TravisEz13
body:
## PR Summary

Draft 6.0.1 change log

## PR Checklist

Note: Please mark anything not applicable to this PR `NA`.

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [x] Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [NA] User facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [NA] Issue filed - Issue link:
- [x] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [NA] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
    - [NA] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 There is one spelling error from the last travis-ci run:
```
The command "pwsh -File tools/travis.ps1" exited with 1.
1.41s$ if [[ "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" == "linux" ]]; then mdspell '**/*.md' '!**/Pester/**/*.md' --ignore-numbers --ignore-acronyms --report; fi
    CHANGELOG.md
        3 | ## v6.0.1 - 2018-01-19 
>> 1 spelling error found in 65 files
```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: restarted Linux CI due to bootstrap failure

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
Question: Is the patch optional or does this mean that the support for 6.0.0 gets dropped? The modern lifecycle doc [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/PowerShell-Core-Support?view=powershell-6) does not talk about patch policy. This question came up because we were thinking whether PSSA is going to be limited to the latest .net core SDK that 6.0.1 has (and will therefore might get incompatible with 6.0.0), assuming that 6.0.0 gets deprecated (hence this question)
This boils down to the question: Can\should a cmdlet built with a newer runtime (minor version or patch) compared to the one used by pwsh be expected to work?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @bergmeister we'll have an Announcements repo with the detailed information similar to how dotnet is doing it.  Regarding support, @joeyaiello is working on an update to the support doc to include patched versions.

title: update 6.0.1 change log
